revised_title: The Effect of Escherichia Coli STa Enterotoxin on Intestinal Surface pH
tldr: This study investigates the effect of Escherichia coli STa enterotoxin and other secretagogues on the mucosal surface pH of rat small intestine in vivo. The results show that STa enterotoxin induces a rapid and reversible alkalinization of the jejunal and ileal mucosae. The findings suggest that cyclic-GMP-dependent secretory processes are more capable of inducing surface pH changes than those dependent on cyclic AMP, making STa a useful tool to investigate the microclimate hypothesis for weak electrolyte absorption.
